inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Clinically diagnosed thoracolumbar and/or lumbo-sacro-pelvic deformity as defined by the SRS/Schwab classification systems as Cobb angle of 25° or greater

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Able to ambulate without assistance and stand without assistance with their eyes open for a minimum of 10 seconds

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Able and willing to attend and perform the activities described in the informed consent process

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: History of prior attempt at fusion (successful or not) at the indicated levels

exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Major lower extremity surgery or previous injury that may affect gait

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: Neurological disorder, diabetic neuropathy or other disease that impairs the patient's ability to ambulate or stand without assistance

notes: The patient is a 14-year-old boy complaining of scoliosis and back pain. He has no other medical condition.
